Reviews.Title: “Very close to the car rental return center”
Reviews.Author: cdeast
Reviews.Content: Decent basic motel. Friendly and efficient check-in staff. Gave great directions to Old town Scottsdale without having to drive on the freeway. Room was fine and met our needs. Lighting and storage were good. Bathroom was clean and a decent size. Had an attached restaurant, however we didn't eat there. Less than 5 minutes from car rental center.Our room location was away from the freeway and was relatively quit. However the noise level from guests leaving for the airport was evident starting at about 4am. Would stay here again - can't beat the very reasonable room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing place to stay after a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Basketballfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last night of our vacation because we had a very early flight to catch and were worried about phoenix/Scottsdale traffic. The location is good for that purpose but, to be honest, our hearts sank when we walked into the room. The web photos were deceiving. Admittedly, the room was clean and the bed comfortable, but the room was so dreary--and expensive considering what you get. Leave the bathroom fan on if you need 'white noise' to block out the planes (yes, the fan is that loud). We've stayed in many Best Western hotels before and this one is probably the most depressing. We had to drive miles to find a good restaurant for dinner. My advice is to risk the traffic and stay in a nicer area of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Airport Location with good shuttle.”
Reviews.Author: Niel01
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this Motel on two occasions within the last month. Conveniently situated about 5 minutes from the Airport Terminal and also from the Car Hire Centre. The Hotel runs a shuttle every 15 minutes to the Airport which seems to work well. Situated close to the junctions of the I.17 to Flagstaff and the I.10 to Tucson in the south. The Motel is situated on two levels, but with no lift which could be a problem to some with luggage. The rooms are clean and ours contained two reasonably comfortable twin beds, room safe, TV and a small balcony. There was some noise overnight from the Airport and Interstates - this was not so bad as to create a problem, but clearly the sound insulation is not as good as it might be. The Motel has a small pool and whirlpool and provides some light refreshment in the morning, but not a breakfast - there is an adjoining Roadhouse Restaurant providing meals throughout the day which seemed quite good. The one disappointment which I had was that, after a long drive from Sedona, they would not let me check in at 2.30pm insisting that it had to be the stipulated 4pm. Can't really complain at that, but most hotels do allow early check in. Apart from that Reception Staff were friendly and helpful. Not an outstanding hotel, but ok and no real complaints - would use again for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Best Western”
Reviews.Author: tootalltraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night in a 2 queen room overlooking the outdoor pool on the second level. No elevator so be prepared to carry "everything" up the stairs. Not a big deal for me but beware for those not adept for that. We didn't use the pool but it seemed very nice and those that were looked to be enjoying it. The room was very comfortable. Everything was clean and overall the grounds were well kept. A minor bug is the hot water in the shower was not consistent. You had to be on the ready to adjust every minute as it would seem to fade away. Another minor annoyance is that we booked the room for 4 people and it was only stocked with 3 bath towels. I'm not in the hotel business but there has to be a way to match the room stock to the customer coming in. Anyway no big deal again to go to the front desk and ask for another towel. The noise level could be a bother to some. You are right next to the freeway and the airport and can clearly hear both in the evening quiet. We live near railroad tracks at home so we are accustomed to noise and weren't bothered by it but you could be if you are a light sleeper. The biggest downer was the front desk friendliness. There seemed to be a cloud of gloom hanging over a couple of the people working the desk while a couple others at least tried but seemed to be restrained by the gloom and doomers around them. At least crack a smile for the love of pete. The shuttle to the airport was nice and the driver was very courteous and friendly. He should be in charge of the front desk. We did eat breakfast at the connected restaurant. It was very good and our server was great. Overall I would stay again for the convenience to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good for access to Sky Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Old_Fahrter
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 times within 3 weeks. The breakfast mentioned by John S was NOT included. Accommodations were decent and the staff friendly but it was for the shuttle service that we returned. The drivers were careful to equip the bus with two child seats when we advised them that they would have a 2 year old and a 4 year old passenger. One of the drivers even came around to the room after we arrived at midnight to bring us a backpack that the child had left in the bus. The drivers seemed to enjoy their jobs even at midnight. It made us feel better after travelling for 12 hours and stressed by the 3 hour time change.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: vatonorteno
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this place is its proximity to the airport. I also liked the free computers for use in the lobby. Now, for the down side. Rooms were not available until 30 minutes after check-in time. The front desk personnel aren't particularly helpful or service-oriented. They were unable to accommodate me for a first floor room or a wake up call at the desk. The room's value is OK, but not the best. The clock in the room and the wake up feature on the phone were both not functioning. There is no elevator to the second floor so one must drag one's bags up the stairs with no help. The very limited continental breakfast is only served until 0800 hours. I wouldn't recommend it or stay again. I think the property can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we needed. We were looking to get away from the cold Illinois weather and this place had a perfect location. The rooms were a decent size and the beds comfortable. The staff was also very nice and friendly. The breakfast had a large variety as well

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay.”
Reviews.Author: KandBOntario
Reviews.Content: Stop over stay for catching early flight out of Sky Harbour in the am. Have stayed at this hotel before and would return.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay for an early morning flight.”
Reviews.Author: PR0506
Reviews.Content: The Best Western was close to the airport & we used the airport shuttle service which was excellent. The rooms were very clean & comfortable. Old tv's..not a big deal. I just thought the price was a little higher than usual for this type of room. However, it was lower than comparable hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport choice for a quick in and out”
Reviews.Author: LadyJLasVegas
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice for a one-night-and-gone trip. I would not want to make this the base for exploring Phoenix. We were getting in late and leaving early - which made it perfect. The hotel is right near the airport and they have a convenient shuttle. There's a restaurant on site, open at 6 for breakfast and at least 11 for dinner. There's free wi-fi (very weak) in the room and a business center in the lobby for printing boarding passes as needed. The rate was very reasonable; the room was clean; parking was free. Not the most exciting place I've stayed - but then I don't think we were actually in the room 10 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Not too hard to find, good price for a quick hotel.”
Reviews.Author: theyoungfamily4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Airport Inn a few weeks ago. Just one adult and a daughter. Easy to find, fairly close to the airport as advertised and a good rate. Not a hotel you want to stay at for a week but for a quick over night not terrible. Rooms were fairly clean but used, good hot water in the shower and a surprisingly comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “No problems except for the directions”
Reviews.Author: itsfordoc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here overnight prior to flying out of the Phoenix airport at 7:00 AM the next morning. No problems with the reservations, check-in process or room. Restaurant on site was suitable. Shuttle left a little late waiting on someone but got the airport in plenty of time. The only issue was the directions posted on the hotel's website. They were not correct! Fortunately, my wife and plan opted for Plan B which was to go together to the rental car return instead of dropping her off at the hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Good of you don't want good food”
Reviews.Author: EdOtt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn twice for connections at the airport. The facility itself is good enough for overnight accommodation, nothing fancy but certainly adequate. The airport shuttle service worked fine. The only serious negative we had was a lack of choice in dining. The attached Roadhouse was mediocre, to describe it charitably, particularly its menu, but there was nothing else available without transportation. Airplane noises were annoying at times, but only what one could expect, I suppose, from a near-the-airport venue without serious sound-proofing

Reviews.Title: “Airport Hotel - with great people”
Reviews.Author: frankhurtte
Reviews.Content: For those of you not familiar with the Phoenix airport it isn't located in the most wnderful of areas. In actuality the neighborhoods arent very safe at all. This hotel is very near the airport but in a a commercial part of town. Safe but isolated. There is nothing within easy walking distance. The building itself has a 70's kind of chain hotel feel. The halls are well lit but a little worn. The rooms themselves are clean. You can see they have been repaired and patched but the appearence is well above average. The beds are comfortable and come with good quality bedding and pillows. The TV is an older style but with a large screen and good working remote. There is a bar in the hotel - a real lifesaver. It is open till 11. So it doesnt create noise or cause bar type issues. The best part of the place is the airport shuttle. Its fast and you dont end up hanging at the airport for hours. As a tip for travelers - you could easily leave 90 minutes prior to an early am flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport location and value”
Reviews.Author: Lynne37034
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on-line and got a good rate. Check in was easy, the attached restaurant made us a wonderful chef's salad to take to our room. The beds were great, room quiet. They also have an airport shuttle and it is very close to the car rental return area. Only other slight problem might be the neighborhood--not the very best.

Reviews.Title: “Lifesavers!”
Reviews.Author: MelWelsh
Reviews.Content: Missed flight in Phoenix, needed a hotel with shuttle service, clean beds and close to airport. BW fit the bill and more! I was traveling with my daughter and 6 yr old grandson, we were tired, upset about the missed flight home, and hot! (we had left Portland Or 34 degrees to 90 in Phoenix) to add insult to injury, our bags were on their way to KC Mo! the hotel shuttle droped us off at Target to buy a change of clothes and picked us up, had us promptly dropped of at the airport the next morning, and all in all saved us! the rooms smelled clean and fresh, the beds were comfy, breakfast is rather weak, as they have a restaurant attached to hotel, just cereal bars, coffee and bananas, but that's all we needed. thanks BW Airport

Reviews.Title: “Did everything it needed to”
Reviews.Author: bass_and_drums
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quality Inn after a long haul flight from London, the night before picking up a rental car. Chose it based on the reviews that have been posted. The beds were amongst the most comfortable we had in a 14 day, 7 hotel tour. The only slight disappointment was we had to wait 35 mins for the shuttle bus from the airport. However, the following morning the shuttle saved us time by taking us directly to the rental car station. Otherwise, everything was as good as expected.

Reviews.Title: “CLOSE to airport”
Reviews.Author: dspmsw
Reviews.Content: very convenient for those using the airport. Good shuttle service. quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nitework
Reviews.Content: This was our best accommodation in the sub-$100 range. Clean, relatively modern (1990s), good service, business facilities with free printing, handy location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for park & fly”
Reviews.Author: twominks
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times when flying out of Phoenix. We live in north central AZ, and have found this a better value than the park & fly's or the shuttle , when there are two of us. Their van ride to the airport takes only minutes as they are so close. The hotel is dated, esp. the hallways & lobby, but the rooms have been clean & comfortable. We also enjoy the ability to get something to eat in their lounge (not operated by the hotel, and also dated).

Reviews.Title: “Look and Book Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: VulcoRoot
Reviews.Content: A shabby dump in a rather rough neighbor hood. It is close to the airport and the hotel deos provide a free schuttle service but I'd still look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, but OK for a night.”
Reviews.Author: Darnoc
Reviews.Content: Tired with a capital "T". BW should work on brand consistency. All over the map. The Good: Free shuttle with very pleasant drivers. Restaurant next door that I didn't use. The Bad: tired lobby and stairwell carpet. A 60's room. The not-so Ugly: efficient if unremarkable checkin.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting broken down hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnGreaves
Reviews.Content: I just wanted a place near the airport to sleep before catching an early flight. At $85 the price and location were good. The room was gross. The carpet was sticky, like maybe someone had spilled a big gulp of mountain dew and it was never cleaned up. The room smelled bad. It was so gross i wore my shoes in the room the whole time. Most of the electrical outlets in the room did not work. The hot water in the shower got constantly colder. I turned the heat on and smoke came from the heater and set off the smoke detector. I used the hot tub in the pool area to soak some muscles sore from hiking in the grand canyon. The water was warm (not hot) and the jets were hardly worth having on. The bed was decent and the tv worked fine. Maybe it was just room 130 that was gross, but I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sicomorotree
Reviews.Content: Even if you are really close to the airport we barely heard the noise. The room was clean and it had a really comfortable bed. It has everything you need (toiletries, soft sheets and towels). The only complaint was that our AC was noisy. Good bar downstairs where you can have dinner and chill. Complimentray breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find!”
Reviews.Author: JHunter26
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for 1 night, but was very pleased with the service and rooms. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and I had absolutely no trouble sleeping. I was up for an early flight in the morning and took advantage of the free coffee and breakfast items offered in the lobby. If you prefer, there is also a restaurant on site. I called the shuttle to come pick me up from the courtesy phones at the airport and it was there in a few minutes. Likewise, it got me to the airport promptly the next morning. The next time I fly through Phoenix, I will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Average Best Western”
Reviews.Author: hotelguest1982
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here. Good value, and room is spacious but it's in an industrial area and not too much of anything around, you've got to drive a bit before you get to a restaurant. Close to airport, but maybe a little too close as jets can be quite loud. Overall good value, and friendly staff. Pool is pretty large.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: CGANESH
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of its proximity to the airport since our flight was arriving rather late at Phoenix. Other than being close to the airport, it offered nothing else. It had a motel like feel and the water in the hotel (or probably Phoenix area itself) is terrible. Please carry bottled water. Another thing we realized was that Phoenix has sprawling suburbs. So if you are in the area to visit the city you may want to stay closer to the attractions

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good service”
Reviews.Author: KJFSwanley
Reviews.Content: Slightly tatty appearance, but good value, friendly and very good service from all staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, drab facilities”
Reviews.Author: skiadct
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while stranded at PHX Skyharbor due to a flight that was diverted in air back to Phoenix :-(. The price was right and I did not feel like paying $150 for a room at Hampton Inn or Garden Inn where I would rather stay. While this hotel needs a major renovation, I had absolutely no problems with my stay. Yah it's not that nicest place, but the bathroom was spotless. The room and hallways very drab, but adequate. Free wi-fi worked just fine. Got a good night's sleep. Where the place really shined was in their service. I forgot my iPhone charger in the room and wanted it shipped to me since they are not cheap, and the staff were so very helpful in mailing it to me. I have heard stories about places saying they will mail you a lost item and it never appearing, but they went above and beyond for me. Even running back up to my room while on hold to make sure they could locate the item. Sandra was super nice about the whole thing and made sure to mail it to me promptly and it arrived about a week later. If this place would renovate and make some upgrades, it would be a blessing to so many people who are forced to stay in airport hotels. Overall, I'm not sorry I stayed there and if I could not find a decent price at my preferred hotel chains, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: stfflngr
Reviews.Content: If you can possibly stay somewhere else , do so !!!! The walls are paper thin , we had a hard time sleeping due to the fact we heard the guy next door to us !!! We had to catch a flight the next day early in the morning !!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly efficient service, basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Sakoro
Reviews.Content: I spent an extra day in Phoenix at my own expense following a business meeting and needed a clean, safe place near the airport to get some rest prior to my early morning flight. This hotel seemed to be the cheapest/ non-scary option that could provide me with a ride to Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and the shuttle van arrived exactly when they said it would. The accommodation was pretty basic, but I didn't really need anything fancy. The mattress was comfortable, the sheets were a little bit worn and there was a hairdryer, TV, mini-fridge and a basic assortment of soaps/ shampoo/ conditioner provided. There is a pool, gym and a diner-type restaurant on-site, but I did not have an opportunity to use them. As an aside, I was very grateful I did spend my final night in Phoenix close to the airport as I discovered that the Phoenix Airport is a madhouse on Saturday mornings. It took me 45 minutes to get through the security lines! If I hadn't arrived early, I would certainly have missed my flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice while waiting for your flight”
Reviews.Author: khawkwv
Reviews.Content: Nice clean place to stay while at the airport. Staff was friendly and helpful. Eating places were far from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “All in all, I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: pepperr
Reviews.Content: Our plane arrived late and the shuttle was there to pick us up, the rooms were very comfortable and we had good service in the restaurant. What more can you want....the place was clean and we were treated with respect. I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Utilitarian only, but clean and decent”
Reviews.Author: pafabu
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here to catch an early next morning flight. The property is old and not in a great part of town - there is nothing nearby worth noting (except the airport). Our room was clean and quiet. Front desk staff was efficient, but not particularly friendly. Not rude, just efficient. The airport shuttle is wonderful. We returned our rental car the evening before our flight and with just a phone call to the front desk, they picked us up and returned us to the hotel. The morning shuttle was prompt. This is not a place to stay for "vacation." It's purely utilitarian, but served its purpose well. We opted to have a pizza delivered rather than eat in the attached restaurant. There was nothing within walking distance to go to, and it didn't appear to be an area in which you would want to go walking. It's a little pricey for the quality, but you're paying for the convenience of the airport proximity and shuttle. All of that said, I would definitely stay here again if my travel plans included a very early morning flight out of Sky Harbor Airport.

Reviews.Title: “No internet...”
Reviews.Author: kevangogh
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times. It's not the Ritz, but the rooms have always been clean and it's close to the airport. So imagine you are a busy traveling businessman as I am who owns a wireless laptop and needs to keep up with emails and what not. You check in here, crank up the computer, and no wireless signal. Well, there was a wireless signal, but all attempts at logging in would hang. This was tried several times throughout the evening - all attempts at logging in at this place failed. No, I'm not a newbie - I have never had this problem anywhere else. Later that evening I see another guest wandering around the parking lot with their laptop looking for an alternative signal to try and tap into, obviously they were having the same problem I was. Bottom line - I need internet access, 100%, no excuses. If they won't provide it, I don't care how close or convenient it is to the airport, I'm staying somewhere else! P.S. - There are two computers in the lobby - one is extremely ancient with a very old version of windows on it, the other usually has a number of customers waiting to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KandBOntario
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice now when flying home from Phoenix. The rooms are clean and quiet. The service has been excellent. The staff was helpful and the airport shuttle on time.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad Overall”
Reviews.Author: GodofWar
Reviews.Content: Located minutes from the airport with great 24 hour shuttle service. Doesn't look like much from the outside but the rooms are in very nice condition with great beds. They have a few computers in the lobby for customers as well as free (and very fast) Wi-fi on all floors. The room service from the restaurant attached to the hotel produced some decent fare. Would stay again but it is a little noisy being so close to the interstate and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Pro: close to the airport; Con: depressing”
Reviews.Author: anATLgirl
Reviews.Content: Well, it's close to the airport...but it's a depressing neighborhood, sad/dark room, and TERRIBLE service in the restaurant. There's no complementary breakfast and area restaurants looked sketchy. There is construction outside the hotel and it's right next to the highway. At least the noise level was pretty constant and the beds were good, so we slept fine. We paid the same price to stay in the Scottsdale Hyatt the week before which is a crime - the Hyatt is a million times better.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean, basic”
Reviews.Author: Weechella
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Airport Inn is fine if you need a clean room, a comfy bed, internet, and reasonable room service. It wasn't too pricey, but wasn't fancy, either. Make sure to note the difference between Streets and Avenues in Phoenix or you could end up wandering around in the wrong part of town looking for this place.

Reviews.Title: “stay at this one!!!”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiRita
Reviews.Content: We have had bad stays at this chain before, but this one is GREAT! Besides being clean, the staff was friendly and very helpful. We have had trouble in the past when asking the staff to freeze our blue ice for us, as my husband is a diabetic, but no problem here, they were glad to help anyway they could. Has a nice bar and restaurant that was open till 10, good food and reasonable prices. So close to the airport,you can't make a mistake. We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest place on earth”
Reviews.Author: happytrails1
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights, but it was so terrible that we checked out the next morning & couldn't get a refund for the 2nd night. Noise from the freeway was unbearable; dark, cave-like room; construction going on in the parking lot; filthy carpet; no continental breakfast. Best Western should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay way, very far away”
Reviews.Author: PrescottJustvisiting
Reviews.Content: Worst stay in many many years. No coffee, no breakfast, terrible freeway noise. Staff has that "lets hang onto our job a few more days" attitude. Says pet friendly but no place to walk dogs. Best advice here, let Phoenix tear this one down and add another lane to the freeway (its close enough it wouldn't be a problem).

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport, good park and fly program”
Reviews.Author: Xybek
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly service desk. The hotel allows you to park your car in their lot for up to 10 days if you stay one night or more. Well lighted and quiet area without too much else around. This is a good place to stay if flying and need to leave your car somewhere. Includes comp 24 hour shuttle to and from PHX airport. Nice place and nothing unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “very low end hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible, the wall paper was peeling, the doors which were new had light gaps all over and when anyone shut there doors down the hall the door would shake. The air did not work unless it was set to 50 which made it feel like you were in a meat cooler. The bar located on the main level was awful, service was terrible and the $15 fish dinner I had did not compare to a box of fish fillets you can buy at your local grocery store. The internet service was a joke if you are a smoker then there is no high speed internet in the smoking wing which is located next to the freeway. There is one bright side to the stay, if you are into the comforts of airplanes taking off and landing on top of you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, poor location, but clean.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This property bills itself as a "Hotel", but it is a MOTEL. Located at the end of the Phoenix airport runway, and right next to the Interstate, so quite loud. If you turn off the A/C for some peace and quite - forget it! The restaurant is very poor, surly service, and there is nowhere else nearby to walk to. There is a pub, kind of smokey and unfriendly though. However, the rooms, however basic, are clean. And the whole place overall feels solid, reasonably new, and safe and clean. A good buget option, but expect no luxuries.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Airport Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 2425 South 24th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85034
